repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.unittitle: AFL-CIO Railway Employees' Department Records on Microfilm

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations (AFL-CIO)

did.abstract: Amendments, Railroad records, Board of Mediation records, Mediation settlement records, meeting minutes, correspondence and office circulars

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Records of the Railway Employes' Department of the American Federation of Labor and Congress of Industrial Organizations (RED). The RED was formed in 1908 to facilitate and coordinate the organizing activities and bargaining strategies of the seven national railroad shop craft unions.

The unions affiliated with RED included: the Brotherhood of Carmen of America; the International Association of Machinists; International Brotherhood of Blacksmiths, Drop Forgers, and Helpers; the International Brotherhood of Boilermakers; the Iron Shipbuilders and Helpers of America; the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers; the International Brotherhood of Firemen and Oilers; and the Sheet Metal Workers International Association. Materials relating to the Machinists and Carmen predominate. The RED bargained with the railroad carriers for these skilled trade employees on a wide range of activities affecting almost every aspect of their social and economic status as employees.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: A negative copy is available upon request.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: AFL-CIO Railway Employees' Department Records on Microfilm #5478 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

scopecontent.p: Reels 1-4. Correspondence (carbons and originals), reports, petitions and printed legislative materials regarding hearings before the Senate Committee on Interstate Commerce on the Howell-Barkley Bill/Railway Labor Bill. Include testimony of labor leaders

Sub-Series 25: Master File of Official Circulars, 1916-1961

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Reels 88-111: Circular letters and newsletters the audience for which were individual unions affiliated with the RED. News items relate to federal legislation and rules changes, carrier initiatives, and to RED activities and those of the individual unions
